image.altText: Regan Huitema walking up a street.

props.synopsis: When Regan buys his first home, the government will own around 30 per cent of it. But he is fast realising that for that to even happen, a lot of things have to fall into place.

title.children: First-home owner's highest offer declined as seller 'put off' by government scheme

image.altText: a bus with pink livery for Tasmanian mobile breastcreening

props.synopsis: Tasmania's health department was aware a 32-year-old breast cancer screening bus was unsafe for years, but continued operating it up until two staff suffered electric shocks.

title.children: Water leaks, electric shocks force 32yo breast cancer unit off road

image.altText: A patron peruses art in a gallery.

props.synopsis: More than three years after a Tasmanian council green-lit a plan to ease the financial burden of the Queen Victoria Museum and Art Gallery, stakeholders worry momentum has stalled.

title.children: 'Treasured' gallery that costs ratepayers millions faces a problem

image.altText: A bright orange bushfire rages through bushland at twilight.

props.synopsis: The Tasmania Fire Service confirms 19 homes have been claimed by a bushfire that ripped through Dolphin Sands this week, while nearly 200 assets have been damaged.

title.children: 19 homes lost and dozens damaged in Dolphin Sands bushfire, authorities confirm

image.altText: Two men stand for photo, holding football

props.synopsis: The Tasmania Devils CEO says the club will likely play in the AFL from existing venues for a year longer than expected, while awaiting construction of the Macquarie Point stadium.

title.children: 'Fair assumption': Devils boss warns debut in new stadium could suffer delay

image.altText: Multiple police cars at a residential crime scene.

props.synopsis: Police found the woman's body on Friday afternoon on Hobart's eastern shore.

title.children: Man, 33, charged with murder of woman in southern Tasmania

image.altText: An aerial photo of Hobart's CBD and Macquarie Point.

props.synopsis: That and other questions answered now that the $1.13 billion stadium project has passed Tasmania's parliament.

title.children: What happens next with the Hobart stadium?

image.altText: A composite shows three men, one screaming while someone pumps his chest, another flexing, another giving hang 10

props.synopsis: A global multi-level-marketing business that sells expensive water ionisers is shifting its target audience to Aussie tradies, but critics say some of their predatory sales tactics are tantamount to a pyramid scheme.

title.children: One of Australia's biggest MLMs is being described as a 'pyramid scheme'

image.altText: Sarra and Craig Saxon-Gill who lost their home in the fire at Koolewong

props.synopsis: Residents on the NSW coast are coming to terms with property loss after bushfires swept through the region on Saturday.

title.children: Sarra and Craig were bushfire prepared, but their home is now ash

image.altText: Two cricketers on a pitch

props.synopsis: The snarl on Steve Smith's face proves conclusively that Australia doesn't just want to beat the English in this Ashes series. It wants to break them.

title.children: England has poked the bear. Australia is out for Ashes domination

image.altText: A view across a wide street of an attractive, two storey goldrush-era corner building with lattice ironwork.

props.synopsis: For its passionate members, saving a historic goldrush-era pub to protect their cooperative was about "economic democracy" and keeping the property out of developers' hands.

title.children: How townsfolk bought a beloved building without going to a bank

image.altText: A robot runs next to a human on an athletics track.

props.synopsis: China used to be trying to catch the West, specifically the US; then it caught up; now the West is trying to catch up to China but likely can't.

title.children: China holds the key to the modern world. The West risks being left behind

image.altText: Oscar Piastri stands on his own

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri missed out on winning the Formula 1 drivers world championship by just 13 points to his teammate Lando Norris, the culmination of multiple small moments throughout the season that cost him dearly.

title.children: Piastri came so close, but these minor moments are what let the F1 title slip away

image.altText: Anika Wells (left) wearing a white suit jacket, Anthony Albanese (right) wearing a dark jacket.

props.synopsis: What was meant to be a Sunday interview bookending a remarkable political year became an exercise in explaining the inexplicable.

title.children: Albanese tries to explain the inexplicable defending Wells's ski trip

image.altText: Pete Hegseth speaking with his hands slightly raised.

props.synopsis: What happened in the lead-up to a second strike on a speedboat in the Caribbean — who knew what and when, and who gave what order — is now under scrutiny.

title.children: The US fired on survivors clinging to a 'drug boat' — who gave the order?

image.altText: a deatroyed house after afire at Koolewong

props.synopsis: Natural disasters are declared in six areas across NSW, as the number of homes destroyed rises to at least 20, with the majority concentrated on the Central Coast.

title.children: Twenty homes now confirmed lost in NSW bushfires

image.altText: several volunteers who joined the russian armed forces line up ready to board a plane

props.synopsis: Through a targeted social media campaign, Russia is offering citizenship and money to foreigners who join its fight in Ukraine, but experts say this is a desperate measure from Moscow.

title.children: Russia ramps up recruitment of foreign fighters despite ceasefire talks

image.altText: A professional woman speaks in front of an EU flag backdrop.

props.synopsis: The European Union says it will learn from Australia's new laws to bar under-16s from social media, with steps to implement the world-first ban already underway and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen praising Australia's "brave move".

title.children: How Europe is gearing up to follow Australia's teen social media ban

image.altText: Silhouettes of two women and a man in front of a faded medical office

props.synopsis: Two women have told the ABC they believe the health regulator is failing to acknowledge the power imbalance between doctors and patients.

title.children: Patient 'traumatised' after doctor did not wear gloves during pap smear

image.altText: A carer pushes Connie. Both are smiling.

props.synopsis: Parents of some of Victoria's most vulnerable people fear what will happen to their loved ones if hundreds of group homes are forced to close.

title.children: Families 'devastated' amid fears of Victorian group home closures

image.altText: A close up of Taylor Swift on stage, wearing a bejewelled leotard.

props.synopsis: From the world's first traffic lights to a Sesame Street legend — how well will you do on our history quiz?

title.children: How well do you remember your December history? Test yourself

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt and Akubra hat sitting with a black kelpie on his lap.

props.synopsis: From hit series Muster Dogs to a new television show, Frank Finger and his beloved kelpie Annie's unbreakable bond steals the spotlight once again.

title.children: Frank Finger and beloved muster dog Annie's emotional final TV appearance

image.altText: A group of young women gathered in a backyard with drinks in their hands.

props.synopsis: We asked two experts for their advice on the etiquette of leaving a social gathering without notice and the best approaches to take if you do need to depart suddenly.

title.children: Is it ever OK to leave a party or social event without saying goodbye?

image.altText: Four children carrying Syrian flags stand in front of a wall

props.synopsis: Today marks one year since the Assad dictatorship in Syria was toppled by Islamist rebels, bringing an end to nearly 14 years of civil war. Some are celebrating, while others continue to struggle.

title.children: Syrians scrape by as cautious celebrations mark one year of 'liberation'

image.altText: Jillian in a gingham top, with short brown hair, on the phone, standing in her kitchen.

props.synopsis: Jillian Hishon has devoted hundreds of hours, listening to an estimated 280 victims of historical child sexual abuse from within the fundamentalist Christian church she grew up in.

title.children: Exploitation and sexual abuse claims in Christian sect emerge via hotline

image.altText: Ribbons tied to fence.

props.synopsis: Newcastle and Ballarat are 1,100 kilometres apart but share a dark bond — scores of suicide deaths linked to historical Catholic clergy abuse.

title.children: Cities 1,100 kilometres apart share dark bond linked to abuse

image.altText: Netflix will have access to the storied Hollywood studio's vast catalogue of films and TV shows.

props.synopsis: A major deal between Netflix and Warner Bros has sent shock waves through Hollywood and sparked backlash.

title.children: Why Hollywood has called the Netflix-Warner Bros merger a disaster

image.altText: An oval sign under a shop verandah saying sacat.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is trying to speed up the transfer of hospital patients into aged care, but advocates say they are "trampling on the rights of older people" in the process.

title.children: Exploitation fears over SA government aged care changes

image.altText: A woman at a computer with a transgender flag in the background.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police fought a legal battle with a transgender woman for more than two years before admitting it incorrectly referred her to men's support services.

title.children: Transwoman took on police and won after being referred to men's help service

image.altText: China's first aircraft carrier, the Liaoning, sails into Hong Kong for a port call

props.synopsis: Japan formally protests the incident, calling it "an extremely regrettable" and dangerous act that "exceeded the scope necessary for safe aircraft operations".

title.children: Japan and Australia urge calm after Chinese radar locks onto Japanese jets

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking.

props.synopsis: The furore over Communications Minister Anika Wells's expenses continues, with just three days until the government's much-anticipated social media ban for under 16s comes into force.

title.children: PM's office approved almost $100k in flights for communications minister

image.altText: Ben Stokes looks upwards after a loss

props.synopsis: England's famed captain-coach duo aren't going to let their relationship fray in the face of the biggest test of their polarising tenure.

title.children: As Stokes questions England's toughness, McCullum warns of 'glass jaw'

image.altText: A woman, her face obsucred, looks at a framed photograph of women and children in the desert

props.synopsis: In the 1960s, the last of the desert families were coming into contact with white people. For one woman, the moment was captured on camera.

title.children: This rare photo captures the 'first contact' between desert families and white Australia

image.altText: Trump furrows his brow as he enunciates a word, staring directly into a camera

props.synopsis: A Republican claimed a win at a by-election in Tennessee this week, but his party colleagues are sounding alarm bells.

title.children: This Tennessee election has set off alarm among Trump's Republicans

image.altText: The charred interiors of a nightclub, with grey floors and walls.

props.synopsis: Local village council official Roshan Redkar tells a news agency that authorities had earlier issued a demolition notice for the club as it had no construction permit from the government, but higher officials rolled back the order.

title.children: Nightclub fire kills at least 25 in India's Goa state
